tool_description: Help your customers print their own labels and stickers, from your own website and under your own branding.
name: Print your own labels and stickers
title: Print your own labels and stickers
tool_name: Print your own labels and stickers

api_list.name: Label templates
api_list.description:
List of label templates filtered by one or more of the following parameters:
paper format
template brand
exact label size
approximate label size
label shape

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description:
Its value can be either 
**Letter**
or 
**A4** 
They represent the two world standard printer paper sizes, respectively 8.5 inch by 11 inch and 210 mm by 297 mm.

optional_parameters.name: brand
optional_parameters.description:
Label manufacturer's name.
This is the current list of possible values. We will continue adding new brands.
Avery
Herma
Onlinelabels
Uline
Megastar
Sheetlabels

optional_parameters.name: code
optional_parameters.description:
It is a string that represents **average** label sizes, in the format [width]x[height].
For example:
**2.5x4**
or 
**70x40**

Being average sizes, means that they represent all sizes that are close to them. 
E.g. **3x2** would represent any other close sizes like **3.062x1.837**.

This concept is useful, when you are going to suggest to your users, which templates do offer label sizes that are equal of close to the label size they need to print on.

optional_parameters.name: shape
optional_parameters.description:
Label shape.
Valid values are:
square
rectangle
circle
oval

api_list.name: Print on dynamically generated label templates
api_list.description:
Generates the PDF file which contains the printout of labels.

The label template will be generated on the fly, based on the label layout dimensions that you will supply on every request.
The content printed on each label, is the image whose URL is supplied by **labelContent** query parameter.

required_parameters.name: rightMargin
required_parameters.description:
The distance from the right edge of the paper to the right edge of the last column of labels.

When the template code is **Letter**,  its value will count in inches.
When the template code is **A4**,  its value will count in millimeters.

required_parameters.name: labelHeight
required_parameters.description:
The height of the label.
When the template code is **Letter**,  its value will count in inches.
When the template code is **A4**,  its value will count in millimeters.

required_parameters.name: bottomMargin
required_parameters.description:
The distance from the bottom edge of the paper to the bottom edge of the last row of labels.

When the template code is **Letter**,  its value will count in inches.
When the template code is **A4**,  its value will count in millimeters.

required_parameters.name: topMargin
required_parameters.description:
The distance from the top edge of the paper to the top edge of the first row of labels.

When the template code is **Letter**,  its value will count in inches.
When the template code is **A4**,  its value will count in millimeters.

required_parameters.name: templateCode
required_parameters.description:
It is the paper format upon which the system will generate the label layout template.
Valid values are **A4** and **Letter**

required_parameters.name: leftMargin
required_parameters.description:
The distance from the left edge of the paper to the left edge of the first column of labels.

When the template code is **Letter**,  its value will count in inches.
When the template code is **A4**,  its value will count in millimeters.

required_parameters.name: labelWidth
required_parameters.description:
The width of the label.
When the template code is **Letter**,  its value will count in inches.
When the template code is **A4**,  its value will count in millimeters.

required_parameters.name: labelContent
required_parameters.description: The Url of the image that you are going to print on labels.

optional_parameters.name: heightRatio
optional_parameters.description:
The percentage of label height that will be occupied by the printed image. E.g. value **80** means that there will be a 10% blank space on top, and another 10% at the bottom of each label.

Default value is **80**.
Minimum acceptable value is **40**, and the maximum is **95**.

optional_parameters.name: marker
optional_parameters.description:
Markers help making sure that printing is perfectly centered on each label.
By default no marker will be printed.

Possible values are:
**0** - no markers
**1**-  Dots
**2**- Ccrosses
**3**- Lines

api_list.name: Print on label templates or plain paper
api_list.description:
Generates the PDF file which contains the printout of labels.

Label layout conforms the label template and three print setup query parameters.
The content printed on each label, is the image whose URL is supplied by **labelContent** query parameter.

required_parameters.name: templateCode
required_parameters.description: Label sheet manufactures, assign a unique code to each of their blank label templates.

required_parameters.name: labelContent
required_parameters.description: The Url of the image that you are going to print on labels.

optional_parameters.name: verticalOffset
optional_parameters.description:
Some printers can feed the paper a bit in advance or delay. As a result, the printout is a bit off by 1 or 2 millimeters in the vertical direction, and the content of the labels is not centered.
This parameter helps you fix this problem and come out with a perfectly centered printout.
E.g. if the printout is positioned about 2mm lower than where it should, set this value to 2 and try again.
If the printout is positioned higher, set a negative value.
Play with this value until your printout is perfectly centered on all labels.

The default values is zero.
Acceptable values are: -3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2 and 3.

optional_parameters.name: marker
optional_parameters.description:
Markers help making sure that printing is perfectly centered on each label.
By default no marker will be printed.

Possible values are:
**0** - no markers
**1**-  Dots
**2**- Ccrosses
**3**- Lines

optional_parameters.name: heightRatio
optional_parameters.description:
The percentage of label height that will be occupied by the printed image. E.g. value **80** means that there will be a 10% blank space on top, and another 10% at the bottom of each label.

Default value is **80**.
Minimum acceptable value is **40**, and the maximum is **95**.

api_list.name: Label sizes
api_list.description:
Returns a list of label sizes in the format [width]x[height].

These sizes are rounded, meaning that they can represent a few other sizes that are close to them. For example size 4"x3", will represent 3.75"x3",  4"x3.25" and so on.

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description:
Its value can be either 
**Letter**
or 
**A4** 
They represent the two world standard printer paper sizes, respectively 8.5 inch by 11 inch and 210 mm by 297 mm.

api_list.name: Label template brands
api_list.description: Returns the list of blank label sheet brands that Ecardify supports to date. If your preferred brand is missing, please let us know.

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description:
Its value can be either 
**Letter**
or 
**A4** 
They represent the two world standard printer paper sizes, respectively 8.5 inch by 11 inch and 210 mm by 297 mm.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://print-your-own-labels-and-stickers.p.rapidapi.com/labelBrands/a4"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "print-your-own-labels-and-stickers.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://print-your-own-labels-and-stickers.p.rapidapi.com/labelBrands/{format}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "print-your-own-labels-and-stickers.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
